item.Description: The time at which the state transition occurred

SALEvent.Description: Event sent at end of readout. When this event is received the corresponding image should be complete in the DAQ 2-day store. Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: Additional keys passed to the takeImages command (: delimited)
Additional values passed to the takeImages command (: delimited, in same order as additionalKeys)
The total number of requested images in sequence
The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The one based index number for this specific exposure within the sequence
The source component of the image name (AT/CC/MC)
The date component of the image name (YYYYMMDD)
The image number (SEQNO) component of the image name
The effective time at which the image acquisition started (i.e. the end of the previous clear or readout)
The requested exposure time (as specified in the takeImages command)
The time at which the readout was completed
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred

SALEvent.Description: Event sent once all telemetry correesponding to the image has been sent. (Typically ~300mS after the end of readout). Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: Additional keys passed to the takeImages command (: delimited)
Additional values passed to the takeImages command (: delimited, in same order as additionalKeys)
The total number of requested images in sequence
The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The one based index number for this specific exposure within the sequence
The source component of the image name (AT/CC/MC)
The date component of the image name (YYYYMMDD)
The image number (SEQNO) component of the image name
The effective time at which the image acquisition started (i.e. the end of the previous clear or readout)
The DAQ assigned image tag (hex string)
The observation date, as computed by CCS (as TAI)
The end observation date, as computed by CCS (as TAI)
The measured shutter open time, as computed by CCS. This is a best estimate based on a summary of the full information provided in the shutterBladeMotionProfile events.
The dark time, as computed by CCS
When using emulated DAQ, this is the name of the image read from the 2-day store (otherwise an empty string)
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred

SALEvent.Description: Event sent at start of image integration. Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: Additional keys passed to the takeImages command (: delimited)
Additional values passed to the takeImages command (: delimited, in same order as additionalKeys)
The total number of requested images in sequence
The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The one based index number for this specific exposure within the sequence
The source component of the image name (AT/CC/MC)
The date component of the image name (YYYYMMDD)
The image number (SEQNO) component of the image name
The effective time at which the image acquisition started (i.e. the end of the previous clear or readout)
The camera data taking mode (normal/calibration/(TBD in future))

The timeout (in seconds) after which the header service should assume something has gone wrong. For calibration mode the timeout will be set to the argument passed to startImage, for normal mode the timeout will be set to expTime.
The time at which the state transition occurred
The time at which the state transition occurred

SALEvent.Description: Event sent at start of readout. Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: Additional keys passed to the takeImages command (: delimited)
Additional values passed to the takeImages command (: delimited, in same order as additionalKeys)
The total number of requested images in sequence
The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The one based index number for this specific exposure within the sequence
The source component of the image name (AT/CC/MC)
The date component of the image name (YYYYMMDD)
The image number (SEQNO) component of the image name
The effective time at which the image acquisition started (i.e. the end of the previous clear or readout)
The time at which the readout was triggered

SALEvent.Description: Event sent describing image readout parameters. Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: The imageName for this specific exposure
A list of all ccds currently configured, of the form RnnSnn, : delimited (empty if entry not used)
The raft bay for each CCD listed above, of the form Rnn : delimited
The CCD slot for each CCD listed above, of the form SXn : delimited
The type of each CCD, this determines segRows, segCols and serCols
DAQ folder where image will be created

SALEvent.Description: Special event for use by header service. All of the information in this event is redundant (i,e. also supplied in other configuration events), but the information in this event is formatted for ease-of-use of the header service, specifically information which is REB or Raft specific is repeated for each CCD. This event will be sent at the same time as other configuration events Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: CCD location in focal-plane (e.g. R22S01) (: delimited). This should be considered the key for all the remaining items, which will be in the same order as the locations, whether they are arrays or : delimited strings.
The raft bay for each CCD listed above, of the form Rnn : delimited
The CCD slot for each CCD listed above, of the form SXn : delimited
Sensor manufacturer E2V or ITL (: delimited)
The name of the CCD sequencer loaded (: delimited)
The checksum of the CCD sequencer loaded (: delimited)

List of patterns that describe which data is to be aggregated and how.

SALEvent.Description: The motion profile for each shutter blade (so normally 2 per image). Note: Note this is overkill for ComCam, but aims to be the same as for the main camera. For ComCam the encoder and hall effect measurements will be simulated, or empty (and probably initially empty). Note 2: The coordinate system in which positions are reported is as yet ill-defined, and the origin (but not direction) may vary between the 2 blades. The data to convert reported position to something more useful will be in the corresponding blade configuration (aka configuration). It is TBD whether we will try to take this out in the positions reported to SAL. Note 3: The maximum number of positions reported by the firmware for both encoder position and hall effect hall sensors is hard-wired to 240. This is used as the array dimension here. The actual number of points reported will be in encoderCount and hallSensorCount. The array element values beyond the count are undefined (but probably 0)

item.Description: Is the blade opening or closing
The time at which the motion started (TAI)
The start position of the blade
Requested position at end of motion
Actual position and end of motion
Actual number of hall sensor transitions
Estimated position of the leading edge of the blade at transition time
true if switch turned on, false if switch turned off
timestamps for motor encoder position measurements (TAI)
Positions for motor encoder position measurements

SALEvent.Description: When this event is received the corresponding image should be complete in the DAQ 2-day store. Once in use this will allow endReadout event to go back to indicating that the readout is complete (sequencers finished). Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The time when the DAQ image was store was complete.

SALEvent.Description: When this event is received, all of the CCS files on the diagnostic cluster have been written Note: all : delimited strings (aka string arrays) follow the escaping convention defined in CAP-572

item.Description: The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The time when the (last) CCS FITS file was written.
The common filesystem location of all files below.
The file system location of each file, relative to rootFileName (: delimited).
The node on which each file is written (: delimited, in same order as above).

SALEvent.Description: Each time a command is executed on a single FITS file this event is generated

item.Description: The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The time when the command completed.
The return code from the command execution.

SALEvent.Description: Event sent when image visualization is ready

item.Description: The imageName for this specific exposure, assigned by the camera
The time when the command completed.
The URL at which the full image visualization is available.
The URL at which the image thumbnail is available.

SALEvent.Description: Event sent when camera summary status changes. Primarily intended to be used by LOVE

item.Description: The time when the last status changed.
The list of subsystems for which summary state is published (: delimited)
The list of states corresponding to subsystems (: delimited).
The list of colors corresponding to subsystems (: delimited). E.g. Red, Green, Yellow, (TBD)
Additional info to be displayed beside state (: delimited).
URL to link to more info for drill-down (: delimited).

SALEvent.Description: Event sent when camera alert status changes

item.Description: The time when the status change occurred
The alertId corresponding to this alert
The description corresponding to this alertId
The current severity level for this alert
The highest severity level for this alert since last clear
Whether the alert has been cleared
The cause corresponding to this alert
The CCS subsystem which raised this alert
Any additional info associated with this raised alert. To allow for future flexibility, usage TBD.
